# Pokemon Trainer Name Editor

This script hacks the command that allows you to edit a Pokémon's nickname, so it instead edits the trainer name.To use this script, simply specify the party slot (starting from 0), of the Pokémon who's trainer name you want to change. During the script running it will still say that you're editing it's nickname, but you'll notice the amount of characters you can edit is lowered to 7.

Since this edits the SetPokeNickName command you have to save reset to use it for it's intended purpose again, editing nicknames.

### Technical Details
This is achieved through two simple edits to the command. The first one lowers the character count from 10 to 7, which is the maximum for trainers.
The second changes the targetted pokemon parameter from the nickname field to the trainer field, so it writes the characters there instead.

WipeFadeStart is called after the code to reset the screen after the code. Otherwise the screen remains black and it can be annoying to open a menu to graphic reload.
